lead_paragraph: The nonbinding guidelines by the federal Centers for Disease Control and Prevention come after arguments with pain doctors and drug industry groups.

byline.contributor: Jan Hoffman and Barry Meier contributed reporting from New York.

headline.print_headline: New Standards for Painkillers Aim to Stem Overdose Deaths
headline.main: C.D.C. Painkiller Guidelines Aim to Reduce Addiction Risk

snippet: The nonbinding guidelines by the federal Centers for Disease Control and Prevention come after arguments with pain doctors and drug industry groups.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention publishes first national standards for prescription painkillers, recommending that doctors try pain relievers like ibuprofen first and prescribe only small supplies of highly addictive pills, in response to growing nationwide painkiller abuse epidemic; guidelines end months of arguments with doctors and drug industry, which have argued restrictions will negatively affect patients who genuinely need pain medication and have in past denied addiction risk.
